title: Drawing, after 1632
medium:
Red chalk on white laid paper
Verso: black chalk,  graphite
signed: Signed in pen and brown ink, lower left: Sarrasin.
inscribed: Inscribed, lower right corner verso: JR.
provenance:
Given by the Misses Hewitt. 
Said to come from the Peoli Collection.
creditline: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt
description:
A figure, presumably Bacchus, is shown leaning with his left hand on a column or pilaster. Marsyas is seated in fetters in front. 
Verso: Figure studies for sculpture: at left: a figure representing a Madonna and Child; center: a kneeling woman; botttom: head and back of a reclining figure; at lower right: a man shown from the front; Top: head and shoulder of a man shown in profile.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, after 1632.
after 1632. Red chalk on white laid paper
Verso: black chalk,  graphite. Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt. 1931-64-242.
